| HistoryText             = Weapon: P.R.I.M.E. first appeared as a group of super-human operatives for [[Department K (Earth-616)|Department K]], working alongside [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] to capture the fugitive known as [[Nathan Summers (Earth-616)|Cable]] and his proteges, [[X-Force (Earth-616)|X-Force]].{{r|X-Force #1|2}}{{r|X-Force #5}}{{r|X-Force #10|13}}

When [[Neena Thurman (Earth-616)|Domino]] and [[Theodore Winchester (Earth-616)|Grizzly]] infiltrated the [[Department K Complex]], they encountered Weapon: P.R.I.M.E. with two three members ([[Double Trouble (Earth-616)|Double Trouble]] and [[Killspree (Earth-616)|Killspree]]).{{r|X-Force #22|23}}

After [[Alpha Flight (Earth-616)|Alpha Flight]] and [[Department H (Earth-616)|Department H]] was officially suspended,{{r|Alpha Flight #130}} Weapon: P.R.I.M.E. was assigned by [[Jeremy Clarke (Earth-616)|General Clarke]] (Department H's former military liaison) to replace them. Under the control of General Clarke, Weapon P.R.I.M.E. was ordered to remove [[Jean-Paul Beaubier (Earth-616)|Northstar]] from the public eye, compounded by his apparent murder of a tabloid reporter. Weapon: P.R.I.M.E. tracked Northstar down, first in Ibiza, then in Russia, finally giving up in New Orleans under orders from their leader, Tigerstryke who came to believe in Northstar's innocence.{{r|Northstar #1|4}}

| Equipment               =

| Notes                   = * The original Weapon: P.R.I.M.E. was to be led by [[Garrison Kane (Earth-616)|Kane]]{{r|X-Force #2}} but when [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] wanted to take down [[Nathan Summers (Earth-616)|Cable]], agent [[George Washington Bridge (Earth-616)|Bridge]] brought them in to help and became field commander of the team.{{r|X-Force #10|13}}
